author: The Conversation
title: The golden age of couture
text: Apple TV drama shows how Dior brought optimism to the war-weary says Christian Dior‚Äôs 1947 ‚Äúnew look‚Äù ‚Äì a collection of extravagantly brimmed hats, wide full skirts and cinched waists that drew attention to the female silhouette ‚Äì signalled a new post-war era of optimism, pleasure and a sense of life returning to normal. Dior‚Äôs haute couture collection remains a historical moment for post-war fashion, and lends its name to Apple‚Äôs new ten-part series, The New Look. The drama explores the state of Parisian couture in the final year of the second world war and the years that followed through the lives of important designers. This includes Dior and his contemporaries Coco Chanel, Pierre Balmain, Crist√≥bal Balenciaga, Lucien Lelong, Hubert de Givenchy and Pierre Cardin. Inspired by true events, the series stars Ben Mendelsohn as Dior, Maisie Williams as his younger sister Catherine, Juliette Binoche as Chanel, John Malkovich as Lelong and Glenn Close as the US Harper‚Äôs Bazaar fashion editor Carmel Snow. The series begins in the wake of Dior‚Äôs huge success with the launch of his new look collection in 1947 with a Q&A at Sorbonne University in Paris. After a riotous welcome from an audience of fashion students, the Frenchman explains: ‚ÄúFor those who lived through the chaos of war, creation was survival.‚Äù This is the theme of the series, revealed in flashback: how the destruction and horror of war affected the world-renowned Parisian fashion market ‚Äì its designers, design houses, those who worked within the industry and the people of France themselves. A central character on and off screen is Dior‚Äôs courageous sister Catherine, who is little known and rarely mentioned in the history of Dior‚Äôs life, beyond the naming of his perfume Miss Dior in her honour in 1947. Throughout the series her fate is emblematic of the French population‚Äôs experience of occupation, and is depicted as the driving force of Dior‚Äôs dedication to couture. In June 1940, Nazi forces took control of northern and western France and its textile industry. By November 1942 the remainder of southern and eastern France fell to the German army. Prior to the occupation, many non-French designers, such as Elsa Schiaparelli, left the country for London, New York and Los Angeles in anticipation of war. Once Nazi forces invaded, Paris and its international fashion markets were effectively cut off from the rest of the world. The couturier Lucien Lelong occupies an important place in the series as Dior‚Äôs supportive employer ‚Äì although much more could have been made of the key role he played in keeping Parisian couture open for business. ‚ÄúCreation cannot stop the bullets but creation is our way forward‚Äù, the character states. True to his word, as war raged, Lelong employed some of the most successful post-war designers in his atelier including Dior, Pierre Balmain and Hubert de Givenchy. Lelong was elected president of the prestigious Chambre Syndicale de la Couture in 1937, and faced down threats from the Nazis to move the entire couture industry to Berlin and Vienna. He negotiated, persuaded and outmanoeuvred the Germans throughout the war by insisting that couture ‚Äì and the domestic textile industry it depended on ‚Äì was uniquely French and therefore could not be replicated elsewhere. The couture industry experienced severe rationing of fabric. But the series successfully demonstrates that Paris fashion continued with determination and innovation. As fashion designers were forced to limit the amount of material they used, unnecessary decorative additions such as ruffles and pockets became expendable. Instead, wartime couturiers turned to embroidery and beading for decoration ‚Äì trends that continue to characterise haute couture today. With the end of the war and freedom from Nazi occupation, Paris fashion was in a fight for its life. Its biggest rival was the American ready-to-wear apparel industry, an aspect of the story this new series dramatises to great effect. Dior‚Äôs 1947 Carolle collection, was renamed the ‚Äúnew look‚Äù at first viewing by American fashion editor Snow. Snow claimed it represented the creation of a new femininity ‚Äì which Dior would later call ‚Äúthe golden age of couture‚Äù. It stood in stark contrast to the austerity wardrobes of wartime Europe and America ‚Äì wardrobes millions of women around the world would continue to wear in everyday creative adaptations and alterations for years to come. What Dior did through his collection was usher in a sense of optimism that women could once again enjoy the pleasure of pretty, feminine clothing that reflected individuality and joy. While the rationing of food, fabric and everyday essentials continued into the 1950s, this new look offered an exhausted Europe the sense that life would begin once more. [ is Senior Lecturer and Researcher in Dress and Belonging, Manchester Fashion Institute, Manchester Metropolitan University. This article is republished from The Conversation under a Creative Commons licence](https://theconversation.com/profiles/elizabeth-kealy-morris-1508314) [Cyprus Mail](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqKggKIiRDQklTRlFnTWFoRUtEMk41Y0hKMWN5MXRZV2xzTG1OdmJTZ0FQAQ?hl=en-US&gl=US&ceid=US%3Aen)on Google News

author: Pulzo
title: Exfutbolista de Millonarios vive necesidades por plata que le debe el club; a√∫n espera
text: En Gol Caracol se transpira f√∫tbol. Encuentra ac√° toda la informaci√≥n de la Selecci√≥n Colombia, las figuras a nivel internacional, lo mejor de la Liga colombiana y el seguimiento del balompi√© internacional. [Visitar sitio](https://gol.caracoltv.com/) √Ålvaro Aponte fue futbolista profesional entre 1986 y 2005. Jug√≥ en clubes importantes como el Am√©rica de Cali, Santa Fe, Tolima y [Millonarios](https://www.noticiascaracol.com/golcaracol/noticias-futbol/millonarios-fc). Y precisamente de ese paso por los ‚Äòembajadores‚Äô, entre 1997 y 1998, a√∫n queda mucha amargura. (Vea tambi√©n: [Ex√°rbitro opin√≥ sobre desempe√±o de Gallo en Millonarios vs. Nacional; critic√≥ a los azules](https://www.pulzo.com/deportes/millonarios-nacional-exarbitro-elogio-desempeno-nicolas-gallo-clasico-PP3819554A)) Todo porque qued√≥ una millonaria deuda, por demandas ganadas en la justicia por el vallecaucano, de la vieja corporaci√≥n que reg√≠a los destinos administrativos del tradicional club bogotano, en cuyo listado tambi√©n est√°n hombres como Bonner Mosquera, Carlos Castro, H√©ctor B√∫rguez, Arley Dinas, y hasta los ya fallecidos Germ√°n Guti√©rrez de Pi√±eres y Ricardo Ciciliano. La actualidad de Aponte, de 58 a√±os, es de estar desempleado. Solamente tiene un trabajo con el Sena y qued√≥ en el aire, despu√©s del cambio de mandatarios locales, ya que antes estaba vinculado hace algunos meses a programas de deporte y recreaci√≥n en Cali y en otras ciudades del Valle del Cauca. ‚ÄúEstamos desesperados, todos los que alguna vez pertenecimos a [Millonarios](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/millonarios-fc), o a ese Millonarios que dejaron en el pasado. No hay una estabilidad laboral, lo que es lamentable. Lo que esperamos es que aparezca alguien que quiera comprar ese lote con un sinn√∫mero de inconvenientes, pero que se pueda vender y que nos paguen‚Äù, explic√≥ en entrevista con Gol Caracol el otrora zaguero central que debut√≥ en 1986 con Am√©rica y fue subcampe√≥n de Copa Libertadores bajo la direcci√≥n t√©cnica del m√≠tico Gabriel Ochoa Uribe. El lote al que se refiere √Ålvaro Aponte es el lugar en el que entrenaron tanto el equipo profesional de los azules, como las divisiones menores por a√±os y que se encuentra ubicado en la Autopista Norte con 226, en el norte de Bogot√°. ‚ÄúYo le gan√© a ese Millonarios en un pleito dur√≥ varios a√±os. Yo mand√© la demanda de manera individual y sali√≥ a mi favor, eso fue como 3 a√±os antes de que se dieran m√°s demandas de gente perjudicada. Esa venta de ese lote se dilat√≥ y es el d√≠a de hoy que a√∫n no hay claridad al respecto. Las necesidades de uno son urgentes‚Äù, agreg√≥ el exfutbolista. Con ese panorama los inconvenientes han aparecido en el d√≠a a d√≠a para √Ålvaro Aponte, quien reconoce que ‚Äúesto lo pone a uno en la situaci√≥n de tener problemas en casa. Todo esto ocurre porque uno no est√° tranquilo ni estable, con muchos inconvenientes en la vida diaria. Uno desea poder estar tranquilo, especialmente cuando lo que desea es disfrutar de su familia, de sus hijos y de la vida misma‚Äù. El nacido en Cali y que tambi√©n tuvo pasos como entrenador por Am√©rica, C√∫cuta Deportivo y Universitario de Popay√°n, de la Primera B, dice no saber cu√°l es el monto actual de la deuda del viejo Millonarios, pero fuentes consultadas por este portal indicaron que √©l es uno de los que mayor cuant√≠a tiene por cobrar. Para finalizar, Aponte dej√≥ en claro que la vida del futbolista cuando se enuentra en actividad es un espejismo y que es falso que por haber integrado n√≥minas de clubes que tuvieron el respaldo de reconocidos narcotraficantes est√°n con un buen presente econ√≥mico. ‚ÄúHay muchas cosas que no son. Muchos piensan que los que jugamos en la √©poca de los Rodriguez ganamos mucho dinero. Los extranjeros s√≠ ganaban, adem√°s que cobraban en d√≥lares. Nosotros ganamos en pesos y poco‚Äù, cerr√≥ el exjugador profesional. LO √öLTIMO [Deportes] Hace 2 horas [üî¥ Juegos Ol√≠mpicos EN VIVO: Colombia busca hacer historia en tiro con arco por equipos](/deportes/juegos-olimpicos-vivo-colombia-enfrenta-prueba-tiro-con-arco-por-equipos-PP3838922) [Deportes] Hace 9 horas ["Una decepci√≥n": taxistas en Paris, enojados por cierres viales y plata que han perdido](/deportes/juegos-olimpicos-taxistas-paris-enojados-por-cierres-viales-alla-PP3838469) [Deportes]
